description: This schema represents sleep duration, either as a single measurement, or as the result of aggregating several measurements made over time (see Descriptive statistic schema for a list of aggregate measures).

references.description: The SNOMED code represents Duration of sleep (observable entity)

sleep_duration.description: Total time asleep from bedtime until getting out of bed in the morning or across the 24-h period. This does not include any time that a person is awake after first falling asleep at the beginning of the night.

effective_time_frame.description: As a measure of a duration, sleep duration should not be associated to a date time time frame. Hence, effective time frame is restricted to be a time interval.

statistic_time_denominator.description: An aggregated result of a phenomenon that occurs over a period of time may need a time denominator of the descriptive statistic to specify its meaning. For example, an average sleep duration over a month time frame without further specification is ambiguous. A statistic time denominator value of d specifies that the value is the average daily sleep duration.
